summary:
Israeli strikes across Gaza killed at least dozens of people today, health officials said, as fighting intensified and aid workers recounted civilian deaths while seeking help. Forces struck Nuseirat refugee camp and other urban centers, destroying infrastructure, blocking routes and shutting hospitals, and nearly half of reported Gaza war deaths have occurred in areas Israel had previously declared safe, according to local authorities; casualty figures are contested. The change today was a marked escalation in urban bombardment and restricted humanitarian access, which will likely worsen civilian suffering and complicate aid deliveries. Near term, international agencies say they may suspend operations if routes remain blocked, and diplomats may press for temporary pauses to allow medical evacuations and aid corridors.

Elsewhere, responses to unrest and governance shaped crises and policy. In the US, the president authorized federal troops to Portland to protect detention facilities; officials cite security, while critics warn of escalation and civil rights risks. The UN reimposed snapback sanctions on Iran, tightening its economy and raising food and price pressures. In Sudan, sieges have driven near‑famine conditions in El Fasher and blocked aid. A political rally crush in Tamil Nadu killed at least 39 people and prompted safety probes. Non-conflict items include plans to roll out a generic HIV prevention drug in over 100 countries by 2027 and Moldova’s elections, which could shift regional alignment. Risks include disrupted aid routes and volatile markets.

headlines.title: Trump authorizes troops to Portland as city deploys forces
headlines.summary: The deployment signals heightened federal involvement in domestic security; officials say it aims to safeguard detention facilities, while critics warn of civil rights risks and escalation.

headlines.title: Israeli strikes kill at least dozens in Gaza as aid workers recount deaths
headlines.summary: Health officials say dozens dead, including aid workers and civilians seeking help, as Israel presses Gaza offensive; the situation threatens aid access and risks further civilian harm.

headlines.title: Israeli attacks kill at least 8 in Nuseirat as displaced Gaza residents face renewed assault
headlines.summary: Israeli forces destroy infrastructure and block routes, hindering medical teams and aid deliveries as civilians flee; the attack underscores urgent humanitarian needs in Gaza.

headlines.title: Desperate residents endure siege as El Fasher faces famine and bombardment
headlines.summary: The siege by RSF has left residents starving, blocked aid, and exposed to bombardment, with limited relief channels and a looming humanitarian crisis.

headlines.title: Generic HIV prevention drug rolled out in over 100 countries by 2027
headlines.summary: Unitaid and the Gates Foundation secure agreements with Indian producers to manufacture cheaper lenacapavir, targeting access in over 100 low- and middle-income countries by 2027.

headlines.title: UN imposes snapback sanctions on Iran amid nuclear concerns
headlines.summary: The UN reimposes penalties that tighten Iran's economy as prices rise and citizens worry about food security, with broader regional tensions increasing.

headlines.title: At least 39 die after crush at political rally in Tamil Nadu
headlines.summary: Thousands gathered for actor-turned-politician Vijay's campaign; investigators are looking into crowd dynamics and safety measures amid ongoing election campaigns in Tamil Nadu.

headlines.title: Nearly half Gaza war deaths reported in areas Israel called safe
headlines.summary: Hospitals shut down as attacks surge; aid access remains restricted, highlighting the humanitarian crisis and contested casualty counts across Gaza's urban centers.

headlines.title: Polls open in Moldova as EU-Russia alignment shapes vote
headlines.summary: Voters decide whether Moldova leans toward European Union or Russia amid domestic debates and corruption concerns, with turnout signaling public sentiment.
